result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Michael Dentice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration
and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 16 days were granted.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for use at agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.

records.addlTxt: Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a GUILTY plea as charged. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 16 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 90 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is  eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

COURT DOES NOT GRANT EXPUNGMENT
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-21-2015 10:00 am

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Video could not be conducted. Defense counsel is requesting plea and sentencing. Court sets the matter for pleas and sentencing.   Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Racine Correctional.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court, in custody by video from Racine County Jail, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. Court grants. Defendant to appear by video from Racine County Jail.  Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
